intro: Spigelia intermedia, commonly known as the red root or Indian turnip, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It features a distinctive reddish-orange root system that is often harvested for medicinal use. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture and emits a faint, spicy odor. Its flowers are tubular and typically pink to reddish, arranged in clusters at the tips of the stems. Spigelia intermedia thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
